meanings.definition: In a scattered or disorganized manner.
meanings.sent1: The toys were sundrily scattered across the room.
meanings.sent2: She packed her bag sundrily, throwing items in haphazardly.
meanings.sent3: The papers flew sundrily in the wind, creating a chaotic mess.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were sundrily jumbled, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The leaves fell sundrily from the tree, creating a colorful carpet on the ground.

meanings.sent1: Each student worked sundrily on their own project.
meanings.sent2: The ingredients were added sundrily, one by one.
meanings.sent3: The ants carried the food sundrily back to their nest.
meanings.sent4: The stars shone sundrily in the night sky, each one twinkling brightly.
meanings.sent5: The books were placed sundrily on the shelf, neatly organized by genre.

meanings.sent1: The storm arrived sundrily, catching everyone off guard.
meanings.sent2: He appeared sundrily at the door, surprising us all.
meanings.sent3: The idea popped into her head sundrily, like a lightbulb turning on.
meanings.sent4: The car screeched to a halt sundrily, narrowly avoiding a collision.
meanings.sent5: The news came sundrily, changing their plans for the day.
